qas.question: The idea of text in cultural studies can include what forms other than written language?
Which two practices have become the main focus in cultural studies?

answers.text: high culture (the culture of ruling social groups) and popular culture

qas.question: What makes up cooperative cultural studies?

answers.text: based on the disciplines of comparative literature and cultural studies

qas.question: The idea of text in cultural studies can never include what forms other than written language?

plausible_answers.text: high culture (the culture of ruling social groups) and popular culture

qas.question: Which two practices have become the least focused on in cultural studies?

plausible_answers.text: the disciplines of comparative literature and cultural studies

qas.question: What has never been studied by researchers?

context: In the context of cultural studies, the idea of a text includes not only written language, but also <a0_0><b3_0>films, photographs, fashion or hairstyles<b3_0/><a0_0/>: the texts of cultural studies comprise all the meaningful artifacts of culture.[citation needed] Similarly, the discipline widens the concept of "culture". "<b6_0>Culture<b6_0/>" for a cultural-studies researcher not only includes traditional <a1_0><b4_0>high culture (the culture of ruling social groups) and popular culture<b4_0/><a1_0/>, but also everyday meanings and practices. The last two, in fact, have become the main focus of cultural studies. A further and recent approach is comparative cultural studies, <a2_0>based on <b5_0>the disciplines of comparative literature and cultural studies<b5_0/><a2_0/>.[citation needed]
